speaker: Graveyard
lines: Iron gates sigh as they swing inward of their own accord.
Yew trees lean like black flames, pointing where the light is thinnest.
Names on stones unspool into the fog; some you think you almost recognize.
A bell that hasn't rung in years thuds once in the ear, then pretends it didn't.
Some graves are dressed in flowers. Some are dressed in snow. Some are dressed in attention.
A path of broken shells crunches underfootâ€”salt, old and stubborn.
The dead do not rest when the living will not let them.
The dead do not rest when the living will not learn.

choices.text: Seek the groundskeeper's cottage by the wall.
Walk the oldest stones where the dates have rubbed away.
Descend the steps toward the family crypts.
